reviewText: The best mexican soap opera I've seen so far. Maria Rojo and Lucero couldn't be better! They both looked amazing. Props to Arleth Theran too for playing the role of Priscila so gracefully !A must buy for mexican soap opera fans.

reviewText: Manana es para siempre! I watched this DVD in the span of one weekend (left work at 2pm on saturday, and only paused to do three things; shower, sleep and go to church)I must warn that I have not watched the full version because it has not been screened in my country. However, I decided to buy the DVD because of the main characters, Colunga, Navarro and Lucero, who I love!! I have seen complaints from other buyers who thought that they were going to get the full episodes, only to be disappointed when they realised that the DVD is an abridged version. Caveat Emptor - These telenovela DVDs are all abridged and are not a full replication of what you saw on TV. Please note that before you get disappointed!!!Now to the DVD. As with these abridged telenovelas, the storyline moves fast, and thank heaven that it does. There may be a tendency to drag while the show is on TV, but on the DVD the story moves fast, and keeps you in suspense. That's why I had to finish it in a weekend. Too much excitement!! I do not know if other loves scenes or romantic moments were excluded from the DVD, but it felt just fine as I watched. They concentrate on the main Plot A characters and not the town gossips of maids and other Plot B and C characters.The DVD itself comes in a good package and the quality of the DVD's is better now that Vivendi is doing them, as opposed to Xenon.As much as I am satisfied with the DVD, I am annoyed at Televisa for three things; for producing abridged versions of these novelas instead of the full versions, restricting the DVD's to Region 1 (USA and Canada), and the subtitles!! Why abridge the novelas? Do they think that we cannot afford the full versions, or that the sales of novelas to TV networks worldwide will reduce? I do not understand the business sense in their decisions!!!Why do they also restrict the DVD region to USA and Canada? I am in Kenya, Region 4, and I have a PS3 (region 2). I had to buy another DVD player that can play all regions, just to watch these DVDs I got. Please take a cue from the K-Drama DVDs. They produce region-less DVDs and they put the ENTIRE K-Drama on DVD. They do not abridge the show!!!Thirdly, they need to put subtitles in other languages apart from English. These novelas are popular around the world and in countries where they do not speak English. I am sure these other fans feel left out when they see that the DVD only has English subtitles!! Do something about that!!Overall analysis. I liked the DVD, I am happy with my DVD, the packaging is good, and I will definately buy more DVD's in the future.

reviewText: Mañana es Para Siempre (Tomorrow is Forever - 815 Minutes)As children, Fernanda and Eduardo are inseparable even though his mother is the cook for her wealthy family. The title for this telenovela refers to a song they danced to as children. When evil Bárbara (Lucero) insinuates herself into Fernanda's family, killing the mother and marrying the father, she realizes that the older sister Lili (Dominika Paleta Paciorek) overheard a phone conversation and knows she killed la señora, so she frames her as a drug addict and has her institutionalized.The kind father had sent Eduardo to private school to get him away from Fernanda when he was warned of their youthful attraction, and our highly intelligent hero parlayed that into a scholarship to Harvard.Eduardo is just returning to Mexico when he discovers that Fernanda seems to have forgotten him and is getting married (they had no communication after he left the hacienda), so he changes his ID and goes by a new name.The local blacksmith is being cared for by his daughter whom he thinks is a nurse, but is really a mud wrestler in a nearby town (don'cha just LOVE telenovelas?).This plot swirls around old family misdeeds, an ancient diary, and an overwhelming need for revenge. The heroine (who hasn't forgotten her youthful love after all), the daughter trapped in a mental institution, and the villainess, who has a very checkered past, are the central characters, with Lucero depicting the most dramatic shifts and conclusion. This is extremely well done with great production values and very attractive stars.Having never seen the entire story, I always assume the missing parts and realize something has to be sacrificed to reduce these stories to 13 or 14 hours. I was glad to see this carried by Amazon.

reviewText: Mexico's biggest male actor, Fernando Colunga, who is considered by some to be the Mel Gibson of the Spanish world, stars in this beautifully done story about true love, betrayal, revenge but above all, romance. At the beginning of this 7 month long novela, Eduardo (Fernando Colunga) and Fernanda (Silvia Navaro) are two young children who's life-long friendship had slowly developed into thier first love. Fernanda, the youngest of three siblings  belonged to the wealthy soceity, living out in the beautiful Mexcian country side in a mansion that consisted of several nursermaids and personal servants, one of whom was Eduardo's widowed mother Soledad. It was a very happy family; but unknown to them all, a dark cloud of consipracy and revenge was looming over the horizon and it would forever shatter the lives of everyone, including Eduardo and Soledad.One day a beautiful young woman named "Barbara Greco" arrived to become the personal assisstant of Monserat, Fernanda's mother. When Fernanda's first communion was celebrated, Eduardo had sceretly given her a necklace which consisted of a heart, and the letters "F E". Fernanda asked Eduardo what that meant, and he explained it was the first letter of both thier names. It was then that they kissed for the first time. Unfortunately, Barbara happed to be standing by and in a fury, took Fernanda away by the hand and informed her father that Eduardo had tried to "take advantage" of her. Infuriated, Fernanda's mother forbided any contact. But becuase Soledad had worked for the family since before Eduardo was born, Fernanda's father offers to finace Eduardo's education in the United States so that he may have "a better and secure future."  Heart broken, Soldedad agreed that her son would be better off getting the education that she lacked all of her life. As the city bus took Eduardo away, a weeeping Fernanda arrived too late to say good bye. Eduardo heard her cries and ran to the back of the bus, sadly waving as his childhood sweetheart ran after the bus in a vain attempt to reach him.Shortly thereafter, Fernanda's mother, who's asthematic, falls severly ill and Barbara was instructed to take care of her. Liliana, Fernanda's only sister, happened to pick up the phone and hear a converstation between Barbara and a very deep-voiced individual at the end of the line instructing Barbara to kill thier mother. Barbara however heard a noise at the other end of the line and ran upstairs where she fould Liliana listening. Barbara locked Liliana inside her bedroom while she proceeded with the orders to finish off Lily's mother. When the father of the houshold arrrived, Barbara informed him that Liliana had gone mad and suffocated her mother because she was caught with drugs in her bedroom. At first he did not believe it, but when he searched Liliana's bedroom, he found drug pills resting on top of her dresser. Shocked, Liliana cried that she did not place them there and that Barbara had killed her mother. Soledad, Eduardo's mother believed Liliana that Barbara had killed her mother and when she confronted Barbara, her life was threatened. Tragically, Liliana was placed in a mental hospital where she would be held for the next 15 years, during which time her father eventually married Barbara Greco.Upon his return to Mexico, Eduardo was devastated by the news that Fernanda was engaged. Even more heartbreaking, was the fact his mother was gravely ill and no longer working for Fernanda's father. Penniless and alone, Soledad's health had declined over the years. Edurado mananged to see her one last time before she died. Full of rage and sense of betrayal by Fernanda and her family, he vowed to seek revenege for the death of his mother, who had done so much for them all, only to be outcasted and separated from him. During a visit from Barbara to Soledad's house, Eduardo overheard her and his childhood friend speaking, during which she inquired about Soldedad's health. When informed that she was deceased, Barbara instructed that "the old hag" be buried as soon as possible, without informing ANYONE, not even Eduardo. It was then that Eduardo slowly began to realize that he and his mother has been a part of some conspiracy. But as he would latter learn, the conspriacy involved Fernanda and her entire family as well. This once sweet romantic story now takes a dark turn, becoming "an eye for an eye." Barbara's dark "source" instructed her to take Fernanda's family and bankrupt them, thus tearing them apart one by one and destroying thier lives. Who is Barbara Greco really? Where did she come from? Who is behind the secret plot to destroy an entire family and why? Will Eduardo and Fernanda ever have the chance to find love in one another again? Find out in this exciting story FULL of twists and plots at very turn.PS I believe this was Lucero's first appearance as a ruthless villian. For those of you who don't know, Lucero is one of Mexico's biggest stars. She is ramarkably talented in both singing and acting; in the past she played the heroine or the woman in distress, but as Barbara Greco, its Lucero at her best performance yet!

reviewText: El Dvd es Exelente, en cuanto a lo Estetico, la Presentacion, el Diseño, los Discos y demas.La Edicion es bastante buena, aunque le faltan cosas, Escenas claves,(Para Mi Importantes). Mantiene la coherencia, pese a ser Resumenes. Contiene la Entrada y los Creditos finales que son los ultimos, para mi la mejor Entrada, la tercera, y en cuanto a la Musicalizacion, es exactamente a la Version Original de Television, lo cual hace muy atractiva a la Historia. Algunas de las Escenas que faltaron son cuando Barbara Greco Mata a Macario, un peon de la casa de campo, y la parte de cuando recibe la condena por ese crimen, si bien esa escena esta, le sacan parte de la escena donde la sentencian por ese homicidio.Note que faltan muchas partes del Final, sobre todo los dialogos entre Fernanda y Eduardo, que realmente valian la pena y eran escenas muy fuertes, cuando ella le reclama por hacerse pasar por Franco Santoro despues que denuncian a Barbara y a Artemio Bravo.La escena de cuando Barbara va a buscar a Aurora a la Acienda esta pero le falta la parte en que Fernanda y Eduardo le reclaman por su falsa identidad, y tambien falta la parte en la que Barbara le reclama a Eduardo por hacerse pasar por Franco Santoro y Barbara le dice a Fernanda quien es.En sintesis esas escenas estan, pero cortadas. Despues algo a destacar que no esta, son unas escenas de Fernando Colunga, (pero no son importantes para la historia), le faltan algunas Escenas de cuando el se va a vivir a las Animas, cuando se corto el pelo, cuando recibe una llamada de Steve y el estaba bañandose y sale en toalla a contestar el Celular, las partes del Gym, en su casa, y parte de ese proceso que tendia que estar en el Primer Dvd.El Dvd 1 esta demasiado resumido para mi gusto, sacan muchas escenas importantes de Barbara con Soledad, peleas, dialogos importantes, todo pasa muy rapido y se nota el corte de las escenas. Maria Rojo tubo buena actuacion en el Papel de Soledad Cruz como para que saquen tantas escenas de ella en el Dvd. Tambien note que de las escenas de los Niños Elizalde hay muy poco, mas bien dejan de Fernanda y Eduardo, pero se pierde mucho de Liliana, Camilo, Anibal, Santiago etc... y otra cosa a destacar es que el proceso de cuando Barbara mata a Monserrat esta pero demasiado apresurado, muy picado.Una escena que heche de menos fue cuando Obregon va a la Acienda a llevarle la corona de flores a Barbara, porque supuestamente habia muerto y ella justo va saliendo y lo ve, lo lleva a un lugar secreto para hablar y ahi proponerle sacarle dinero a los Elizalde por el rescate de Liliana, (eso esta), lo que esta cortado y me hubiera Encantado verlo nuevamente, es la parte donde ella se Rie, como nunca, y es super tentadora la escena, cuando Obregon le dice que publicaron en un periodico de la zona que ella habia muerto, esa escena donde Barbara se tienta de risa es unica, super comica, y lamente mucho que no la hayan dejado, la verdad es una pena, porque estaba muy buena la escena.Lo demas esta muy bien. Si me hubiese gustado que esta Edicion tubiera algun Extra, Bloopers, Entrevistas, Detras de Camaras, Galeria de Fotos, Trailer, Promos, Videoclip etc..., algo, pero no contiene nada de eso, y me parece mal, ya que la Telenovela tubo muy buen Rating, en todo el Mundo, y hasta un Final de 3 Hs, un Dia Domingo, no todas tienen ese Privilegio, y esta era una buena Oportunidad para conmemorar ese Exito.La Telenovela esta Protagonisada por Fernando Colunga y Silvia Navarro, en su Primer Protagonico, cuenta con la Actuacion Antagonica de Lucero, como Barbara Greco/Rebeca Sanchez. (Para Mi) es el Mejor Papel Antagonico de la Historia, el Personaje de Lucero es Sublime, Exelente, sin dudas... Me Encanto!!! Ademas la Novela cuenta con un Gran Elenco, de Primera Calidad.El Dvd Contiene una Duracion de Mas de 13 Horas de Resumenes con Lo Mejor de la Telenovela, son 797 Minutos Aproximadamente, aunque en la Contratapa dice que son 815 Minutos, pero yo sume los 4 Dvds, uno a uno y me da 797 Minutos, 13 Horas y 17 Minutos.No entiendo realmente porque dice que dura 815 Minutos, NO ES VERDAD...Yo Ordene el Dvd al dia siguiente de su Lanzamiento Oficial y Tengo las 2 Ediciones: Region 1 (Usa) y Region 4 (Mexico), Mañana es Para Siempre forma parte de Mi Coleccion de Telenovelas en Dvd.
summary: Comentario sobre la Edicion en Dvd de Mañana Es Para Siempre

reviewText: This story gets 4 stars only because Fernando Colunga is in it. He's making up for the dragging plot and weird edits. You will enjoy it, but you will inevitably feel like the novela is just GOOD instead of being a MASTERPIECE. Like, it missed its chance somewhere in all the unnecessary goings on.
